---- var scrollContainer = new qx.ui.container.Scroll(); this.getRoot().add(scrollContainer, { edge : 0 }); .... and then adding few widgets to the scrollContrainer. ---
If I reduce firefox browser window size, I see that both vertical and horizontal scrollbars are shown and basically are working. However, I don't see any actions when I press key up or down (I hope everybody knows these keys for scrolling a content).

The issue is reproducable in one of our demos: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/1.6/demobrowser/index.html#ui~ScrollContainer.html It works with dragging the scroll cars (obviously), and also with mouse wheel (provided you mouse-over the container). But pageUp/pageDown and keyUp/keyDown keys have no effect, however you try to get the container focused.
In the framework, it seems that qx.ui.container.Scroll is a leaf class that is not used by other framework classes, neither as a superclass nor as a child control. Rather, other classes (like form.List) extend the common superclass qx.ui.core.scroll.AbstractScrollArea, and implement key handling on their own.
It should therefore be side-effect-free if we implement key handling on container.Scroll.
